reviews.review_msg: Stephen is very experienced and does not read off lecture slides. He adds on using examples. You don't really need the textbook, slides should be sufficient to do well in this course.   Only downside is you don't really know what to expect for exams and marking scheme for the exam is unclear.
I liked his style of teaching, and he's a good lecturer.  Exams really test you on general knowledge, not specific things.  Overall, it was a good class.
The grading is totally subjective. He's not a hardworking guy, and personally didn't learn a lot from this course. However, stories in the class are sometimes interesting.
